image.altText: A large building burns as people walk through the street in the night in front of it.

props.synopsis: Violence erupts on the streets of Port Moresby after a payroll error docked about $100 from the pays of public servants across the country.

title.children: Chaos in the streets of Port Moresby after 'technical glitch' hits public servants' pay

image.altText: Two ambulance cars and several police cars on main street

props.synopsis: New South Wales Police say the man was shot and killed in the main street of Nowra after he confronted police with a handgun.

title.children: Man shot dead by police in Nowra's main street after confronting police with gun

image.altText: Black and white 'for rent' sign

props.synopsis: Canberra is still the second most expensive city to rent – behind only Sydney – but the capital’s rental prices were flat in 2023, bucking the national trend which saw the median cost rise by 13 per cent.

title.children: Canberra's rental market remained flat through 2023, but these suburbs saw a jump in price

image.altText: Several woman sitting and singing in a building

props.synopsis: As Ukrainian authorities consider another mobilisation to bolster military ranks as it fights a Russian invasion, young men are already hard to find in the village of Krasnopillia, and it's a similar story around the country.

title.children: In Ukraine, war is causing new consequences: men are missing

image.altText: A flooded dirt road

props.synopsis: The clean-up has begun for many Victorians affected by flooding this week, but others are still waiting to return home as the water slowly recedes.

title.children: Victorians still recovering from the 2022 floods set to begin clean-up process all over again

image.altText: Two men shaking hands.

props.synopsis: Secretary of State Anthony Blinken speaks to President Mahmoud Abbas about reforming the Palestinian self-rule government, as Israeli strikes in southern and central Gaza continue.

title.children: Blinken seeks Palestinian governance reform for postwar Gaza as deadly Israeli strikes continue

image.altText: A composite image of an Israeli tank next to a set of blue scales.

props.synopsis: International law experts say South Africa's genocide case against Israel could put political pressure on Israel and its allies, forcing a change of tactics in the Gaza war.

title.children: Could the genocide case against Israel have an impact on the war in Gaza?

image.altText: Water sitting in a dam with green grass around it.

props.synopsis: After lowering Paradise Dam's wall due to safety concerns, its operator Sunwater now says a $1.2 billion plan to restore it won't be enough to make Bundaberg's main agricultural water store safe.

title.children: Controversial Queensland dam is suffering 'too many issues' and will have to be completely rebuilt, operator says

image.altText: Covid germs hover over a graph on a black background

props.synopsis: Several states have warned of another COVID wave driven by a new variant called JN.1. Why is it so infectious, and what is it doing to case numbers around Australia?

title.children: How one mutation means an already-transmissible variant jumped the 'next hurdle'

image.altText: Wide shot of three turbine floating on top of the water with two boats

props.synopsis: Despite concerns about harms to marine life posed by wind turbines, experts say they can create new marine habitats.

title.children: 'Like a shipwreck on a seabed': How wind turbines can become homes for marine life

props.synopsis: For two million years, Gigantopithecus blacki roamed the forests of what is now southern China. A new study claims to discover when — and why — it went extinct.

title.children: The story of 'Giganto', the world's largest ape, and why it disappeared forever

image.altText: Large black bear resting on a wooden structure.

props.synopsis: The extraction of bear bile involves animals being hunted and caged in farms across Asia, despite the fact the trade in these products is illegal almost everywhere – including Australia. But there is an end in sight.

title.children: After 20 years in a tiny cage, these 'broken bears' are finally feeling the grass beneath their paws

image.altText: A close shot of a man wearing a suit and tie against a black background.

props.synopsis: The protracted battle over secrecy in the now defunct prosecution of lawyer Bernard Collaery is finally over, five years after he was charged with breaching national security laws, with a redacted appeal ruling released.

title.children: Judge gave 'too much weight' to national security in deciding if Bernard Collaery matters should be heard in open court

image.altText: A low angle photo of a post office in Britain

props.synopsis: One of Britain's biggest miscarriages of justice, the wrongful conviction of hundreds of Post Office workers due to faulty software, has exploded into the public domain following a TV drama, sparking demands for justice.

title.children: Former British Post Office boss gives back royal honour amid fury over accounting scandal

image.altText: Elon Musk Twitter account is seen in this illustration.

props.synopsis: The eSafety commissioner says the social media platform's hate-monitoring practices are "jaw-dropping" after it reinstated thousands of banned Australian accounts.

title.children: Online safety regulator accuses Elon Musk's X of adding fuel to a fire of online hate

image.altText: A woman in dungarees and her daughter hold hands in a Smiggle store, smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: The start of a new school year can be a costly time for families, especially as cost-of-living pressures continue, but there are some ways families can save on essentials.

title.children: A new school year can be a costly time for families, but there is help available

image.altText: In a khaki-coloured dress, Melania stands in front of a microphone in front of US flags

props.synopsis: Melania Trump announces her mother's death on X without revealing a cause.

title.children: Melania Trump announces death of her mother, ending speculation about her whereabouts in Christmas photo

props.synopsis: A space company with plans to launch 50 rockets a year from the remote NT has dismissed fears about missiles being launched from the site, but still has ambitions to work with defence.

title.children: Space firm dismisses fears expansion could make Arnhem Land a military target

image.altText: A country town main street, with a four-wheel drive in the foreground and palm trees.

props.synopsis: Police said fentanyl, a synthetic opioid far stronger than morphine and heroin, posed an "extreme danger" and warned the Katherine community to remain alert.

title.children: Police make urgent plea for information after fentanyl stolen from NT medical clinics

image.altText: an old identification tag found in a rock pool, it has 'aust' 'b pos' and '1104679' engraved on it

props.synopsis: An identification tag found by beachcombers in southern Tasmania sparks an online quest to find its owner. But an ABC listener may have put the case to bed.

title.children: Mystery 'dog tag' found in Bruny Island rock pool captures the imagination of online sleuths

image.altText: Inside a plane oxygen masks hang from the roof above empty seats near a large hole in the side of the aircraft. A runway outside

props.synopsis: Boeing CEO Dave Calhoun has acknowledged errors by the plane maker after a Boeing 737 Max 9 had a panel blowout mid-air on an Alaska Airlines flight.

title.children: Boeing CEO admits errors, says mid-air blowout 'can never happen again'

subjects.title: Air and Space Accidents and Incidents

image.altText: A smiling woman stands next to a man, whose face is blurred, in front of a glass door

props.synopsis: Raelene Polymiadis is released from jail after being rearrested on Monday, with police alleging she breached her strict bail conditions on five different occasions.

title.children: Woman charged with murdering elderly parents released from jail for a second time

image.altText: Thick clouds of black smoke and a giant orange and yellow flame and rocks surrounding it.

props.synopsis: The parents of Jonathan Udall will receive a cash settlement of $US100 million ($149 million) after he and four others were killed in a helicopter crash in the Grand Canyon in 2018.

title.children: Nevada judge approves $149 million settlement to parents of British tourist killed in Grand Canyon helicopter crash

subjects.title: Air and Space Accidents and Incidents

image.altText: A woman with dark hair and earrings looks at the camera with a neutral expression

props.synopsis: Police are renewing calls for information into the disappearance of 30-year-old Angie Fuller, one year after she was last seen on the side of a remote Central Australian highway. A $250,000 reward for information remains active.

title.children: One year after her disappearance, police say people 'know what happened' to Angie Fuller

image.altText: Alex Bolt leans on the net and looks down in disappointment

props.synopsis: Sydney wildcard Christopher O'Connell marches into the quarter-finals of the Adelaide International but South Australian Alex Bolt's dreams of a home fairytale are denied emphatically by top seed Tommy Paul.

title.children: Hometown hero Bolt beaten in Adelaide, but Aussie wildcard moves into quarters

image.altText: Cameron Bancroft holds up his bat

props.synopsis: George Bailey rejects any suggestion Cameron Bancroft's Test absence is political, telling the opener the ball-tampering scandal is completely in the past.

title.children: Ball-tampering scandal not behind Bancroft's Test omission, selectors say

image.altText: A large wave washes over a jetty as dark clouds loom in the background.

props.synopsis: Squally thunderstorms and falls of up to 100 millimetres are expected in coastal areas of the Top End and Kimberley region as a later-than-usual monsoon arrives into Australia's northern regions.

title.children: Cyclone possible as 'monsoonal surge' arrives in the Top End and Kimberley in coming days

image.altText: A bespectacled man with short grey hair and a neat beard stands outdoors, looking solemn.

props.synopsis: An anti-Zionist activist involved in a protest against an Australian armoured steel manufacturer has pleaded not guilty to assaulting one of the company's employees.

title.children: Jewish protester denies assault during demonstration against supply of Australian steel to Israel

image.altText: A group of male Jewish students sit behind an opening in a wall. Police tape and religious books on desks in foreground

props.synopsis: Police say 10 people were arrested during a scuffle with officers after a secret passageway was discovered.

title.children: How a secret tunnel in a New York synagogue led to a brawl between police and worshippers
